tutorial.title: Yield to Call of a Bond
tutorial.scenario:
IBM has just issued a callable (at its $100 par value) five-year, 8% coupon bond with annual coupon payments. The bond can be called at par in one year or anytime thereafter on a coupon payment date. It has a price of $103 per $100 face value, implying a yield to maturity of 7.26%. Calculate the yield to call of the bond.

Play
tutorial.step: Press the RESET button to clear all the previous entries.
Enter the number of periods (in this case 1 for 1 year), and then press the N button. If the bond was called after two years, you would simply use 2 instead of 1.
Enter the dollar coupon payment per period (in this case 8), and then press the PMT button.
Enter the price you would receive when the bond is called (in this case 100 for the 100 dollar face value), and then press the FV button.
Enter the present value or price of the bond (in this case 103), and then press the +/- button followed by the PV button. This amount represents the amount that the bondholder paid for the bond.
Press the CPT button, and then the I/Y button to solve for the yield to call of the bond.
